text: Michael Robert Kremer (born November 12, 1964)U.S. Public Records Index Vol 1 & 2 (Provo, UT: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc.), 2010. is an American development economist of Jewish descent. He is the Gates Professor of Developing Societies at Harvard University. In 2019 he was jointly awarded the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economics, together with Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Duflo, "for their experimental approach to alleviating global poverty." ==References== ==Other websites== * Home page * Innovations for Poverty Action Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:Jewish American academics Category:Jewish American scientists Category:Jewish Nobel Prize winners Category:Harvard University faculty Category:Educators from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City
